note: A magnificent Merlot, with gorgeous fruit that's ripe, rich and distinctive. The bounty of complex flavors includes enticing black cherry, currant, blackberry and spice, with a smooth chocolaty aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 2,510 cases made.

Absolutely gorgeous on the nose, with currants, blackberries and freshly cut flowers. Full-bodied, with ultrafine tannins and a solid core of fruit. This goes on and on on the palate. The essence of class and refinement. Relatively good value, considering the superb quality. No better Cos since 1989.  Best after 2010. 20,830 cases made.

A stunner. This coats the palate with cassis, blackberry and boysenberry fruit, but stays focused and pure, with vanilla, spice and toast notes chiming in on the palate for added effect. The finish then resonates with purity. A thoroughly seductive wine that glides effortlessly, despite its obvious power and depth. Carmenère, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2009. 3,000 cases made.

Suave, sophisticated, rich and concentrated, but remains balanced and polished, with bright blueberry and blackberry flavors supported by toasty, vanilla-scented oak. A modern wine with great structure and harmony. Best after 2005. 1,800 cases made.

Absolutely fantastic. This is one of the most exciting young reds I have tasted in a long, long time. It shows intense aromas of berries, currants and minerals, with hints of mint. Full-bodied and packed with fruit and tannins, its long finish is refined and silky. A benchmark for the vintage. Las Cases has always wanted to make first-growth quality in a top-notch vintage, and it certainly did in 2000. Best after 2012. 15,000 cases made.

Rich in character and aristocratic in structure, a noble red that wears its subtle cherry, blackberry, chocolate, pepper and sweet spice flavors on a polished frame like a bespoke suit, letting them all play out elegantly on the well-buffed finish. Drink now through 2015. 3,800 cases made.

Blockbuster. Both modern and traditional, a full-bodied red that bridges the past and the present. This is packed with Turkish delight dessert, ripe and sweet fruit, lush tannins, with lots of spicy, smoky character and a round, caressing feel in the midpalate. Best from 2006 through 2012. 5,830 cases made.

A completely seductive and appealing '01 spätlese. Seamless and airy in texture, yet layered with peach, citrus and mineral aromas and flavors enmeshed in the delicate frame. Lovely finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,500 cases made.

Smells like freshly picked orchids, with loads of ripe, clean fruit. Full-bodied, medium sweet and very powerful and racy. It lasts for minutes on your palate. Yet there's a balance and class to this young Vintage Port. This is the greatest glass of Graham I have ever tasted, young or old. Best after 2014. 9,000 cases made.

Dark, with fantastic aromas of currant, blackberry, spice and lightly toasty oak. Full-bodied, with very well-integrated tannins and a texture as fine as the best cashmere from Scotland. Superb. Needs time in the bottle to show its full potential. One of the new hot wines of Tuscany. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2008. 3,330 cases made.

Rich, dense and distinctive for its pepper and exotic spice notes weaving through the chewy cherry pie, dried blueberry and coffee flavors, echoing forever on the long, long finish. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases imported.

Wonderful aromas of flowers, honeysuckle, fig, butter and hazelnut. Rich, silky flavors that are elegant and refined, with a creamy, citrus-laced finish. Vibrant acidity gives it backbone and sustains the flavors on a long, minerally aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 702 cases made.

Gloriously ripe, decadent and complex, offering coffee-scented blackberry, currant, cherry and exotic spice aromas and flavors that extend and expand on the subtle, elegant finish. A graceful wine that packs in plenty of flavor and lasts and lasts. Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2010. 900 cases made.

The nose shows loads of plum, spice and meat aromas, as well as hints of licorice. It's full-bodied, with firm, yet velvety textured tannins. It's big and rounded. If you can't afford Las Cases, try some of this. Some might call this a second wine, but it comes from a plot of vineyards not deemed worthy of Léoville Las Cases. So it's like its own estate. Best after 2009. 20,000 cases made.

wine_full: Coteaux du Languedoc Pic St.-Loup Cupa Numismae
note: Pure, intense red, with delicious red plum, berry, game and spice flavors on a muscular frame. Pepper and leathery notes linger appealingly on the finish. Almost Hermitage-like in its structure.  Drink now through 2006. 4,700 cases made.

Now we are talking. Wow. Aromas of licorice, flowers and crushed blackberries. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with lovely smooth, fine tannins and a long, sweet fruit finish. Greatest young Vintage Port of Smith Woodhouse I have ever tasted. Best after 2014. 4,000 cases made.

A beautifully understated spätlese, with subtle power, density and length. The passion fruit, sweet corn, berry, fennel and mineral notes are layered and just keep coming at you. Superbly balanced, it seems effortless and ethereal. The finish just melts away. Best from 2005 through 2020. 250 cases made.

Deep purple, with loads of ripe plum, black cherry and blackberry flavors, scents of violets, dark fruits, new leather, currants and minerals. A real mouthful that manages to show elegance and a measure of finesse. Long, gushing aftertaste. Drink now through 2012. 850 cases made.

Essence of blackberry, dark cherry and smoke make this an alluring and distinctive red. Intense concentration and a firm structure provide loads of power. Dark chocolate notes dominate the finish. Still quite youthful, but should develop nicely in the years ahead. Best from 2004 through 2008. 3,000 cases made.

wine_full: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Winemaker's Reserve
note: A rich, flamboyant style, from its wonderful aromatics to its opulent display of fruit and oak flavors. The mix of fleshy pear, fig and smoky oak combine to open all kinds of flavor doors. Finishes with mineral and lemon-citrus scents. Drink now through 2006. 1,958 cases made.

wine_full: Coteaux du Languedoc La Méjanelle Cuvée Sommelière
note: Full-bore, decadent red, with dark plum and blackberry flavors. Bacon fat notes mixed in. Rich, deep and lush, with dark chocolate and espresso notes on the finish. Powerful. Drink now through 2005. 6,000 cases made.

Tangy, with bold citrus, melon, green apple and mineral flavors that grow as they linger effortlessly. Beautifully put together, this has all the earmarks of becoming great with cellaring. Best from 2005 through 2010. 600 cases imported.

Incredibly rich, with masses of ripe fruit on the nose, from plum to blackberry, showing smoky oak undertones. Full-bodied, with layers of silky, ripe tannins and a long, fruity, almost jammy finish. A real triumph. Moccagatta is a leader in Barbaresco right now, and this is one of the greatest wines ever from this producer. Best after 2010. 550 cases made.

A dense and rich red, with aromas of blackberries and blueberries, with an undertone of minerals. Full-bodied, with lots of tannins and loads of structure and length. Just a baby, but already muscular and developed. Best wine from this estate in years. Same owner as Léoville Barton. Best after 2010. 7,580 cases made.

Extremely well-done. Beautifully aromatic, with coffee, cedar and blackberries on the nose. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a mineral, blackberry aftertaste with medium fine tannins. I haven't had a Lagrange of this quality in years. Best after 2010. 25,000 cases made.

wine_full: Chardonnay Edna Valley West Slope Edna Ranch
note: Remarkably complex and elegant, with a delicious range of flavors built around vibrant pear, nectarine, honeysuckle, creamy fig and light toasty-hazelnut scented oak. Turns sleek and vibrant, with a wonderful aftertaste of complex flavors. Drink now through 2005. 4,362 cases made.

Big and concentrated red, with plum, berry, currants and cherry character. Full-bodied, with thick tannins and a long, rich finish. Dense wine. As impressive as the 1997. Best after 2004. 2,250 cases made.

Crackling, live-wire Sauvignon, with textbook gooseberry, grass, lime and mineral flavors on a racy frame. Pure and long, with great acidity rippling beneath it all. Let this emerge fully in the cellar. Best from 2004 through 2006. 11,500 cases made.

Powerful and well-structured red, with dark plum, smoke and dark cherry flavors, and loads of meat and coffee notes. Full-bodied, with licorice and mocha elements on the long, long finish.  Best from 2004 through 2007. 6,600 cases made.

Ultrarich and ultrathick. A full-bodied, stunningly sweet-tasting Northern Rhône, it delivers a ripe mouthfeel and plenty of fruit, mineral and toasty, smoky character. Long, balanced finish. Great Hermitage red from Guigal. Drink now through 2012. 4,580 cases made.
Very, very impressive for this estate. Blackberry and cigar tobacco, with hints of toasted oak. Full-bodied, with loads of velvety tannins and a long finish. Best after 2010. 10,000 cases made.

Very attractive aromas of ripe plum, berry and grilled meat. Full-bodied, with lovely fruit and big, silky tannins. The finish is fantastic, with very ripe fruit, yet refined and caressing in texture. Best after 2008. 2,080 cases made.

Impressive. A sophisticated red, with a modern accent, showing vanilla, mocha, chocolate and smoke, all of which complement nicely the ripe and sweet fruit. Full-bodied, clean and racy. Harmonious finish. Drink now through 2015. 6,500 cases made.

Layers and layers of fruit. Intense aromas of blackberry, tobacco, mineral and dried mushroom. Full-bodied, with big velvety tannins and rich and wonderful fruit. Long, long finish. Goes on and on. I like it better than the outstanding 1998. Clerico is a master again. Best after 2010. 550 cases made.

wine_full: Zinfandel San Francisco Bay Carla's Vineyards
note: Dark and chocolaty, with zesty wild berry and blackberry fruit and lots of spice and espresso scents. The long, rich, concentrated aftertaste showcases the exotic fruit flavors. Drink now through 2008. 2,100 cases made.

Rich and plump, a flood of fruit, with powerful blackberry, plum and a wee touch of peppermint, all echoing through the long finish. A serious McLaren Vale Shiraz, built to last. Drink now through 2012. 5,000 cases made.

Gorgeous balance and grace in this peach- and mineral-flavored Riesling. Great clarity and delicacy defy the amount of flavors deftly positioned on its lightweght frame. Plenty of snap and a chalky texture on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

Blackberry fruit claims center stage in this powerful red, where it mingles with tobacco and coffee notes and plenty of smoky oak. Massive tannins give structure, but the fruit reemerges on the finish.  Best after 2004. 1,000 cases imported.

wine_full: Muscadet de Sèvre et Maine Sur Lie Château de Chasseloir
note: This Muscadet offers rare explosiveness, with concentrated lemon peel, grapefruit, honeysuckle, mineral and briny notes. The racy acidity carries it along effortlessly, while a second wave of fruit emerges on the finish. Hard for Muscadet to be better than this. Drink now through 2004. 15,000 cases made.

wine_full: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
note: An uncommonly rich, almost sweet-tasting Chardonnay that packs in lots of flavors yet manages to be elegant and refined. It offers layers of fig, apricot and ripe pear, shaded by exotic spices and pretty oak. Drink now through 2007. 3,886 cases made.

Old-fashioned, this full-bodied traditional wine seduces with its decadent game, saddle-leather, plum and sautéed wild mushroom aromas. No hint of fancy oak, just a mouthful of Châteauneuf character that swirls around to a long, sweet finish. Another great négoce red from Guigal. Drink now through 2008. 23,330 cases made.

Beautiful white Burgundy, incredibly ripe yet very pure and showing lovely mineral character. Some toasted oak, but mostly ripe pear, tropical and lime notes. Full-bodied, it sings on the palate to a long, long juicy and sweet finish.  Drink now through 2012. 3,200 cases made.

Seductive, elegant and refined, with subtle but rich flavors, in a full-bodied package that includes ripe fruit, spice, smoke, plum and quince pie. Tightly wound (but sweet) tannins, and a burst of mineral make this particularly long and clean on the finish. Best from 2007 through 2020. 16,665 cases made.
Brisk, floral style brims with pear, grapefruit and passion fruit aromas and flavors, which linger effortlessly on the vibrant finish. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

A beauty. Dark, with beautiful aromas of blackberry, mineral and spice. Full-bodied, with a solid core of fruit and tannins and a long, long finish. Pure Sangiovese. Best after 2006. 5,800 cases made.
Like a laser beam, this wine zaps the palate with ripe apple, peach, citrus and mineral notes, then exits as cleanly as it entered, leaving you wanting more. Drink now through 2006. 3,800 cases made.

wine_full: Merlot Peumo Marqués de Casa Concha
note: Smoky and ripe, with black currant and plum fruit, hints of herbs, cocoa and toast, and fleshy, mouthfilling finish. Feels like it has the stuffing to cellar a bit too. This label is really strong these days. Drink now through 2005. 20,000 cases made.
Loads of crushed raspberries, minerals and spices on the nose. Full-bodied, and concentrated, yet very refined and tight. A lovely elegant claret. Seriously good. Best after 2005. 13,330 cases made.

Terrific range of flavors, excellent balance and a wonderful sense of harmony. The mix of blackberry, black cherry, anise, sage and toast make this a most inviting wine. Not shy on muscle or tannic backbone, either, as it's quite chewy on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 7,800 cases made.

This is a powerhouse, with lemon curd, chamomile, honeysuckle, white peach and mineral notes on an incredibly lush frame, yet it's all supported by riveting acidity underneath. Terrific cut and length here, with remarkable persistence on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 1,915 cases made.

Bright and generous. Impressively balanced to show touches of ripe melon against tart grapefruit and lime flavors that echo nicely on the lively, delicately herbal finish. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

Fabulous bottle. Very, very classy aromas of freshly cut flowers, crushed berries, with hints of cedar. Full-bodied, yet extremely reserved, with fine tannins and impressive fruit. However, it's all in balance. It goes on and on. Best after 2005. 833 cases made.

Rich, bacony aromas and flavors mix with alluring dark plum and red cherry flavors in this broad-tasting, full-bodied red. Intense blood, iron and mineral notes linger with spicy elements on the powerful finish.  Drink now through 2007. 1,500 cases imported.

Really fine Sauvignon here--juicy and vibrant, with lemon, chive, chalk, nettle and mineral notes, and a long, lively finish. Strong grassy edge to the finish adds dimension. Drink now through 2004. 11,000 cases made.
Super effort. Complex aromas of milk chocolate, plum and coffee, with hints of game. Full-bodied, soft and round tannins, with a ripe fruit finish. Lovely wine. Best after 2005. 12,675 cases made.

Brilliance and clarity highlight this Riesling, whose peach, grapefruit and spice notes are brought into focus against the vivid structure. Subtle, lingering finish. Drink now through 2006. 5,000 cases made.

Brighter, livelier and juicier than most Australian Shiraz, a vibrant wine with crisp blackberry, plum and vaguely leafy-herbal flavors that persist beautifully on the harmonious finish. Drink now through 2010. 23,000 cases made.

A gorgeous wine. This shows beautiful perfumes of ripe fruit, with hints of spicy oak and dried flowers. Full-bodied, with superfine, silky tannins and a long, long finish. Best from 2004 through 2008. 18,180 cases made.

Absolutely wonderful aromas of flowers, currants and citrus. Full-bodied, yet very, very refined, with a center core of fruit that tastes like crushed raspberries and goes on and on. Greatest wine from this estate since 1945. Best after 2010. 18,750 cases made.

Supple and seductive, a lush mouthful of blackberry, blueberry and plum flavors shaded with some subtlety by black pepper, olive and vanilla notes, all of it lingering effortlessly on the remarkably refined finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

A bright and fruity Soave, with ripe apple and apricot character. Medium-bodied, with good fruit and a long finish. You don't get better than this for value in Italian whites. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

Plump and generous, a deep, plush-textured red that bursts with plum, blackberry, vanilla, white pepper and cream flavors, which echo beautifully as the flavors last and last on the gorgeous finish. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2015. 20,000 cases made.
Light in texture, but the flavors pile up nicely, growing from delicate berry to rich plum and spice as they fill the mouth on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 16,373 cases made.

Ripe, fresh and juicy, with immense generosity, brimming with mineral-scented, honey-kissed apricot and peach flavors, supple on the finish and nicely laced with just enough acidity to keep it long and lively. Drink now through 2008. 10,000 cases made.

Lots to like here, with citrus peel, straw, mineral, lemon curd and peach notes. This bouncy Sancerre has length, vibrancy and balance and begs for food. Delicious. Drink now through 2005. 30,000 cases made.

wine_full: Shiraz McLaren Vale The Footbolt Old Vine
note: Bright and jazzy, with delicious blackberry and cherry and subtle touches of anise and pepper weaving through the lively, long finish. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases imported.

This dark red impresses with its solid structure and good balance. The flavors are muted now, but the concentration is evident, and a core of wild plum and toast notes will open with time. Best from 2004 through 2009. 10,000 cases made.

This excellent wine is a relatively good value for the quality. Intense aromas of berry, spice and pepper follow through to a full-bodied palate, with silky tannins and a rich finish. Best after 2004. 5,800 cases made.

A beautiful Champagne. Complex and elegant, evoking ginger, jasmine, citrus and honey aromas and flavors, accented by a biscuit and grain component coming as much from barrel fermentation as yeast aging. Very firmly structured and long. Enjoy with Asian foods or Parmesan cheese. Drink now through 2006. 9,500 cases imported.

Intense coffee, spice and ripe berries on the nose. Full-bodied, with lots of soft and silky tannins and a long, long fruity, berry and vanilla aftertaste. Reminds me of the excellent 1989, which I am still drinking with relish. Excellent value here.  Best after 2007. 24,665 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Alpha Apalta Vineyard
note: Lovely fruit here--cassis, red currant and blackberry--with supple texture. Yet there's serious grip, with mineral, cocoa and toast notes as well, all framed by firm yet well-integrated tannins. This should develop nicely. Drink now through 2006. 20,150 cases made.

Quite reliant on jazzy oak, but it's also quite rich and concentrated, with appealing currant, black cherry, anise, mineral and leathery notes, finishing with pretty coffee ground notes. Drink now through 2009. 88,858 cases made.

Elegant, vivid and sophisticated, showing pure fruit flavors of blackberry and blueberry, accented by vanilla from oak and kept lively by crisp acidity. Well-proportioned and well-integrated. Drink now through 2012. 3,000 cases imported.

Lovely stuff, it manages to be rich in flavor yet delicate in texture, offering raspberry and mint-scented cherry and peppery spice flavors, which linger effortlessly on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,100 cases made.
Wonderful aromas of spice, blackberry and incense. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a long, long finish. Very well-crafted.  Best after 2003. 12,000 cases made.

Serious juice here, with deep, vivid purple color, loads of plum, boysenberry and blackberry fruit, extra layers of meat, mineral and toast, and a terrific velvety texture despite the dense, muscular tannins. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made.

Smooth, rich and concentrated, with a tasty core of plum, blackberry and wild berry shaded by toasty, smoky oak. It all comes together on the finish, where it turns complex and plush. Drink now through 2007. 9,213 cases made.
Intense and lively, with freshly squeezed lime and green apple flavors that are enlivened by acidity, giving this a long, fruity, cleansing aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 6,340 cases made.

Loads of rich flavors yet with a sense of elegance and finesse, with layers of ripe, spicy, apple, pear and buttery notes, finishing with lively, well-integrated acidity and a burst of flavor on the aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 18,000 cases made.

wine_full: Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills Botella
note: Dark, firm, rich and intense, with lots of concentration to the black cherry, blackberry, fresh earth and blueberry jam flavors. Well-focused, with mouthcoating, integrated tannins and a long, pure, rich aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 536 cases made.

Terrific juice, pure and driven, with red and black currant, cassis, bittersweet chocolate, graphite and espresso flavors. Serious depth, with the fruit coursing through the finish despite its youthful tightness. A classy wine. Cellar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Best from 2004 through 2008. 1,600 cases imported.

Starts off dark and dense, but quickly finds a sense of elegance that lets the pepper- and licorice-scented blackberry and cherry flavors come sailing through, echoing beautifully on the firm, fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2010. 17,000 cases imported.

A luscious, velvety texture carries plum, toast, spice and licorice flavors in this generous red. Tannins are big, ripe and round, the finish sweet and spicy. Drink now through 2012. 4,700 cases made.

Dark, rich and polished, with complex, concentrated currant, tobacco, olive, bell pepper and blackberry flavors. Finishes with a flash of spicy, toasty oak and ripe, integrated tannins. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Best from 2004 through 2011. 9,000 cases made.

A beauty, in the international style. Dark color, lavish oak, ripe fruit and muscular structure mark this red. Flavors range from cassis to chocolate to mineral. Balanced and deep.  Best from 2005 through 2010. 1,500 cases made.

A floral white, delicate and graceful, this combines apple, citrus and mineral flavors with a slim yet medium-bodied frame. Its silky texture and seamlessness reveal its pedigree. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

wine_full: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Seven Hills Vineyard
note: A racy, wild, generous Syrah, juicy with lively acidity balancing the raucous blackberry, plum and a whiff of mineral and gamy character that wafts through the long, aromatic finish. Tannins are subdued, and it all holds together nicely. Drink now through 2010. 960 cases made.

Beautifully crafted, sleek, rich and refined, with a tight, elegant beam of spicy pear, citrus, honey and fresh, clean earth. Tapered on the finish, where the flavors are long and detailed. Nary a trace of oak in this classy debut Chardonnay from HdV. Drink now through 2007. 1,500 cases made.

Beautifully crafted, with wonderful, complex aromas and a smooth, seductive texture. Layers of currant, cedar, herb, coffee, olive and mocha, turning remarkably elegant and supple. Ripe, well-integrated tannins give it a long, flavorful finish. Drink now through 2010.

Gorgeous aromas of plum, blackberry and violet. Full-bodied, with bright, delicious fruit and refined tannins. Long, long finish. As a Chianti Classico riserva should be. Drink now through 2008. 3,300 cases made.

Beautifully polished, complex but balanced, this impressive red shows ripe fruit, judicious oak and a vibrant sense of place. Not overly muscular, but finely proportioned and deeply flavored. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases imported.

Beautifully crafted, exquisitely balanced and rich in currant, exotic spice and ripe blackberry fruit. Turns spicy and exhibits pretty mocha-scented oak, with a long, broad, rich aftertaste. Drink now through 2010. 5,320 cases made.

Lovely richness, fleshing out the honey, litchi and grapefruit peel notes. It gets good support from a moderately firm structure, with a touch of bitterness shoring up the long finish. Best from 2004 through 2008. 1,600 cases made.
Beautiful and elegant, with silky, ripe fruit. Medium-bodied, with medium, fine tannins and a caressing finish. Very fine. Excellent value. Best after 2007. 5,400 cases made.

Etched in stone. Dry and tightly wound, this conjures up a limestone cliff after a thunderstorm. Quince and peach also mingle in its rocky depths. Firm and concentrated, this is for rock hounds. Best from 2005 through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

Simply delicious, overflowing with flavor. Inky dark, ripe, rich and plush, with a load of jammy plum, blackberry, wild berry and spicy aromatics. Finishes with a long, complex aftertaste and a gush of fruit. Tannins are well-integrated. Drink now through 2010. 600 cases made.

A big wine, with fascinating aromas of black licorice, berry and toasted oak. Full-bodied, with loads of ripe fruit and velvety, fruit-coated tannins. Long finish. Easily the best wine from this producer this year due to the richness and balance. Best after 2008. 1,500 cases made.

wine_full: Brunello di Montalcino Vigna di Pianrosso
note: Wild berry, cherry and floral aromas to this Brunello. Full-bodied, with big, silky tannins and loads of exciting fruit. Lively, yet refined. These wines are a joy to taste. Giuseppe Bianchini is a master in the vineyards.  Best after 2004. 3,900 cases made.

Tightly wound and firmly concentrated, it opens up to unveil a wealth of rich, exotic spices, with beefy bay leaf, earth and mineral scents to a dense, chewy core of beefy currant, blackberry and new leather, finishing with espresso, mocha and vanilla flavors that make it quite enticing. It should only get better in the next year. Best from 2005 through 2012. 430 cases made.

Fat and rich, with a botrytislike dried apricot, dried peach, fig and honey character. Has the opulence of a grand cru. Silky. Full-bodied and harmonious, but not as long as it could be on the finish.  Drink now through 2010. 700 cases made.
